sections.heading: dot-viewer
sections.text:
dot-viewer
is a dot-format graph debugger in TUI, inspired by Vim.

children.heading: i. Graphviz
children.text:
dot-viewer
parses a dot format file using C bindings to
Graphviz (v7.0.6)
.
The system environment should be able to find and include the following header files.
#include
<gvc.h>
#include
<cgraph.h>

children.heading: Option 1. Installing Graphviz from Package Manager
children.text:
Coming from Linux,
$
sudo apt install graphviz-dev
And coming from vanilla Ubuntu, you may want to install these too.
$
sudo apt install build-essentials cmake
$
sudo apt install clang
Coming from Mac,
$
brew install graphviz
And coming from Apple Silicon Mac, and
add an environment variable
,
export
CPATH=/opt/homebrew/include

children.heading: Option 2. Building Graphviz from Source
children.text:
Or, try building from the source code following the
guide
.

children.heading: ii. xdot.py
children.text:
dot-viewer
renders a subgraph with
xdot.py
, an interactive dot visualizer.
It is required that
xdot is executable in command-line
beforehand such that the following works.
$
xdot
*
.dot

children.heading: i. Initialize
children.text:
First initialize and update the submodule
dot-graph
.
$
git submodule init
$
git submodule update

children.heading: ii. Run
children.text:
Then run crate.
$
cargo run --release [path-to-dot-file]
This will open a TUI screen on the terminal.

sections.heading: 2. Features
sections.text:
With
dot-viewer
, users may
traverse the graph in TUI
using,
goto next/prev node of the currently selected node
fuzzy search on node name
regex search on node name and attributes
make and export subgraphs
using,
subgraph tree selection
applying filter on search matches
neighboring
n
nodes of the currently selected node

children.heading: Normal
children.text:
Key
Actions
c
close the current tab(view)
h/l
move focus between current, prevs, nexts list
j/k
traverse in focused list
n/N
move between matched nodes
gg
move to the topmost node in focused list
G
move to the bottom node in focused list
tab
/

children.heading: Search
children.text:
Key
Actions
tab
autocomplete search keyword
enter
apply search
e.g., in fuzzy search mode,
/g1_s14_t100
and in regex search mode,
r\(H: ., D: .\)

children.heading: Command
children.text:
Key
Command
Actions
filter
apply filter on current matches, opening a new tab(view)
neighbors [depth]
get up to
depth
neighbors of the current node in a new tab(view)
export [(opt) filename]
export the current tab(view) to dot
xdot [(opt) filename]
launch
xdot
with the filename or
exports/current.dot
by default
subgraph
open a popup showing subgraph tree
tab
autocomplete command
enter
execute command
All exported files are saved in
exports
directory in the project root.
Most recently exported file is copied in
exports/current.dot
.
